cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 30 miles NW of Great Inagua Island
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northwest then turning north-northwest, paralleling the Southeast U.S. coast toward the Carolinas and Mid-Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the southeast North Carolina coast in the vicinity of Wilmington

weather_observation.watch_coast: East coast of Florida from Ocean Reef to Sebastian Inlet, and Lake Okeechobee (no watches yet for the Carolinas)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire U.S. East Coast from Florida through the Carolinas and Mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–50 kt) possible late Monday night into Tuesday, brief hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out at landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of surge possible along the lower Cape Fear River and adjacent barrier islands if the center comes ashore near Wilmington.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could produce 4–6 inches with locally higher totals, leading to flash flooding in low-lying areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents beginning this weekend; minor river flooding possible after passage.
